reviews.text:
Maroon Bells - Visit September 2018 during Fall.

It's been on my bucket list ever since I first saw a picture from this fantastic place.
Finally here but only for one evening/morning, to enjoy The Bell's in all its beauty. 
I tried from my home in Denmark to read how and what to do, if you want to drive yourself. Not being overwhelmed or not being able to find  the information, I decided to make this attempt for a short walk-through. 

When the road is open (Closed during winter), you can drive your car to the park, but only if you get there before 8 am or after 5 pm. It's mandatory to buy a parking ticket, otherwise your car can get removed/towed. (The Car pass  cost $10, and is valid for 5 days)
You are NOT guaranteed a parking spot though. When the parking lot is full, it's all over. Arrive early. I would recommend around 6-7 o'clock.

Attention: You either buy a car pass ticket at the Welcome Station when its open (I think open hours is 7am -7pm, and Welcome Station is located halfway between the roundabout in Aspen and the Bells), OR you pay at the Self Service Pay Station, right past the Welcome Station on the right side. If you arrive early in the morning (and it's pitch dark), I would recommend a flashlight, a pencil and 10$ (Cash or check) 
Take an envelope at the self service, fill in your information, and put the envelope and money in the green fee tube.

Then drive to the parking lot, find a good spot and wait for the sun to rise.
Enjoy ;)

It is difficult to say when the timeless beauty of these two sentinels mirrored in the lake is more striking: In the summer, when every hiking trail takes you through fields of wild flowers, in the fall, when tall aspen trees dazzle with a rainbow of fall colors, or in the winter, when snow and ice silence the world. The best photo opportunities are from one of the many hiking trails – access by motor vehicles is limited.

The Bells are one of the most photographed locations in America. Offering challenging climbing and opportunities to make your own adventure in the Wilderness Area, this is a must see place in CO. If you have the chance, come for the fall colors!

Really gorgeous place. The parking lot is tiny so you pretty much have to take the shuttle bus from the ski resort. The facilities are very limited, however the bathroom building is nice and big. If you've never been, you have to go see the Bells.

Stunning views. People complain about the bus fee, but the bus drivers provide really interesting info and stories. The ride is also longer than you think. It may be helpful to have a bottle of water during the summer. Dogs are allowed.

Products are very expressive even with a value card. I could just go down valley and get a better affordable price. However, the major flaw with Aspen city market is the employees and how terrible they are trained. The problem must be the management because else who trains the employees? If the employees performance lacks due to poor training, and the manager trains the employees; therefore, the managers are not training the employees correctly. I have heard criticism that the HR's treat them poorly and unjustly. Even heard that they guilt trip their employees. Who does that? I love shopping at City market for quick pick ups, but u can't help to find myself seeing managers mistreating these employees. As a result, the employees underperform and creates aisle clogs. Don't get me wrong I do not like to acknowledge the "behind the scenes" of management, but if this is management then there is something wrong with Aspen's city market.
Nice market right in the middle of town. Isle ways are a little tight but staff was very helpful. Great selections and a perfect deli. A must stop if you’re in town for a while and need groceries.

Small location but solid selection. The prices are reasonable and City Market doesn't spike up the prices just because it's located in Aspen. Only complaints is that because it is small is that it's usually always crowded, although the lines move pretty fast. Store seems a little outdated too if you pay attention to the flooring and shelving.
Quick, had a good selection, including a fast n reasonable ready to eat dinner takeout option.
Very nice people,  reasonable prices.  Good selection

My family and I decided to eat here while on vacation this week.  Aspen has been an incredible trip; except for dining at this restaurant. Where do I start; our waitress had a look of complete apathy the entire evening, we waited way too long for our food and when it arrived it was cold and extremely average. We had to walk up to the bar to get our drinks because after asking twice, our waitress just never got them. I will not be eating here again and would not recommend this place.

One of the worst restaurants I've ever been too. Not one of our 4 people dishes was done well. You would expect a $40 dish to have something of value but I much rather have gotten a rotisserie chicken from the local grocery store. It'd be better prepared then from here
Staff took excellent care of us. Beautiful presentation of food and great wine selection! Everything we had was delicious!!

Why didn’t I listen to the comments of the 1 and 2 star reviews?! Don’t make the same mistake I did! We were seated on the patio at approximately 9:20 a.m. today. They close breakfast service at 10. My daughter ordered for us while I ran to the bathroom. We did get our drinks, but then....nothing. No one came by to check on us for awhile. At one point, the hostess came by and asked if everything was ok and we were like, yeah. Then, our waitress finally came by and cheerfully said, how was everything? We replied we hadn’t gotten our food yet (it was about 9:40 or so at this point). She scooted away to check on it. Come to find out, the order hadn’t been entered! 🤬 When the food finally arrived, there was a few issues - my toast wasn’t toasted and my daughter’s eggs were over easy instead of the over medium that she ordered. The breakfast potatoes were really good. We were both happy (she didn’t mind that the eggs were undercooked) with our meals, thus the 2 points. Once we had our food, we felt rushed to finish - they kept stopping by. Then, they brought the check and said they comped us 50% for the trouble. Then, when I went to pay, I handed her $20 for a $14.90 bill. She asked if I needed change - um, yes! She gave me change in ones instead of a five, which frustrates me when staff does that. I’ve docked stars for the service and the fact that the food wasn’t as we had ordered.
Oh wow,  breakfast was delicious. Lots of food and the breakfast potatoes I could eat all day. Coffee was good and everything was cooked perfect and nice and warm.

I've enjoyed many good meals at the Hickory house and Aspen. They have fantastic BBQ and are very reasonably priced.  Today I had breakfast at the HH for the first time.  They  did not disappoint.   I had the Chicken Fried Chicken and my wife had the Breakfast Burrito.   Both were great.  Ample portions, and again, reasonably price.   Enjoy Western Lodge Style atmosphere, great service, and food.

I can't count a time when this place isn't busy. Even though it's a crowded place the servers, and cooks do an excellent job at making the visits pleasant. There's a great selection of steaks, burgers, ribs, and other assorted barbecue styled food. The only reason I don't give it a five star rating is because of how crowded it usually is, but that's probably because the food is so good. Other than that, I'd say it's an excellent place to get a great bite to eat in Aspen at an affordable price.

Got the "Beast" pulled pork. Huge serving of great meat. The pork alone was a bit lacking in flavor, but extremely well made and the specialty bbq sauces were great. 

Our seat was near the door and we were bumped by nearly everyone that walked by whole sitting at an uncomfortable tall metal table. This place should have remodeled during the road construction last year. The layout is terrible. The atmosphere is great, but don't plan on moving around in this cramped place.

This restaurant claims to have the best ribs in the entire state of Colorado. Wife and I shared a rack of baby backs.   They are good but I've had better on the front range.  For the money this is a good BBQ place but I won't be coming back if I can help it.
Wonderful place! Our waitress remembered all the orders for all 10 of us - very impressive. Great ribs!!

I come here every time I’m in Aspen. The town is hard because most of the food is overpriced but here you get a good bang for your your buck. World famous for their Burger but many things on the menu are equally as good. The menu changes seasonally but not drastically . The burger, the tacos, the chicken noodle soup are great entrees. The edamame, fried pickles, and chips and guacamole are great starters. The drinks are amazing too. Custom cocktails and the originals.
We went expecting it to be a scene based on popularity, but sat and had a wonderful time with exceptional service.  The house nuts were divine.
First time in 10 years and just as fun and interesting as ever!!! Best chicken noodle soup in the world

I worked at the Jerome in high school and early in college when I was home for summers and the winter. The JBar is a beautiful piece of Aspen history with incredible bar nuts and drinks. It is homey and while pricy still feels like a place where the locals go for a nice before dinner drink.
Still a must-do when visiting Aspen! Very historic bar with classy and cozy atmosphere.

Food is good, not great, but service and attitude of owner ruin the experience.  The goal is to get as many people through and turn tables as fast as possible.  We have eaten there several times, but the last 2 times the owner came to our table within 1 minute of receiving the check and asking us to leave and move to the over crowded bar.  ruined the otherwise okay experience
Lamb chops were done do tender. Good wine selection.

You can't go wrong with this place, other than forgetting reservations! Every dish will be guaranteed as the best _______ ever! You can also just go there for the bar, but the food is off the chart! Very romantic place!
Amazing!! One of the best meals I have ever had!!
Really great. Colorado lamb meatballs were outstanding.

Another locally owned place that we have enjoyed and loved for a long time. If you want to feel like you have an inside track on what’s happening in Aspen, this is the place to go. Cool staff, with lots of familiar faces. Food is simple, tasty and well prepared. Atmosphere is very warm and lively.
Best Italian food in Aspen, and some of the best we’ve eaten in the States. Ultra happening bar scene, where the most beautiful women in Aspen can be found. Good time every time we visit.

I've been going to Campo for many years, And by far it is the best Italian restaurant in Aspen. Great service, Nice atmosphere, and cozy vibes, and most importantly delicious authentic Italian. The staff is super friendly and incredibly attentive. I would highly recommend Campo De Fiori to anyone visiting Aspen
Favorite local place. Great Italian food. Warm and gracious servers. An absolute don't miss while in aspen!
Don’t miss it!!!   Fantastic food and a fun, lively atmosphere make this restaurant our top pick in Aspen.

It was a great place. Sucks that it had to close. Soon the retail at the place is gonna close to and all except the boogies kids shop across the street will close. The true boogies in the boogies building will be closed. An iconic piece of Aspen. 🙁 Sad to see it go

Cloud Nine is an amazing experience. The food and beverage options are not your typical ski lodge fare. Expect a fine dining experience in a lodge combined with a party atmosphere. The staff is dynamite!  Expect to have a great time, but be prepared it will cost you.
It’s the most amazing two-hour life experience you’ll ever have...!

most beautiful mountain 
restaurant in the world. THX

If you are in Aspen this is a must.  I know there are plenty of reviews with pros and cons, but this is truly an incredible party.  We were lucky enough to score patio seats on NYE.  When the time is right be prepared with your bottle(s).  I wore some of my old ski gear here after reading the reviews!  You will most likely leave a little wet.  Don't go if you will get upset about being sprayed with champagne.  The party is the epitome of carefree partying in Aspen.  It's not 5k for table service but the people around are spraying $135 bottles of Clicquot like there is no tomorrow.  The inside smells of pure champagne when you walk in to use the restroom.  Some people even get the champagne guns when they buy the larger bottles.  Some people even drop their snow gear and sport their bikinis and speedos.  Come prepared to have fun and spend some money.  

Skiing after this party is a little more difficult than I anticipated!
Fun! Shampoo? Champagne!! Non stop party!!

I had the pleasure to dine  here on Friday and it was a stellar experience from start to finish.  I am a chef so i have very high standards and every dish was exceptional.  The service was five star without a doubt.  The ambience was absolutely delightful.  And after dinner, we moved to the lounge area to enjoy the DJ who had fantastic taste.  This is now  my new favorite restaurant in Aspen.  I will recommend to all my clients. it's not just cozy and classy...it's sexy as heck!

Great Cocktails front of house team is excellent and the kitchen creates amazing plates... Beautifully presented with creative flavors and textures. Great vibe in the restaurant, make sure to book if you want a table

My fourth visit and I will never go back.  General Manager Antoine made us feel unwelcome by switching our round table for a long one and showing no cares at all.  Food came out cold and for each course 1-2 dishes arrived 5 minutes after the rest of our party (7 of us).  Incredibly loud...I was shouting at my friend who was sitting next to me.  Bathrooms were gross.  Our waiter was good and Asst GM Curren is a great guy.  The place is much better when Antoine is back in St Barth’s or anywhere other than Aspen.
Great service! The meal  you will never forget. Amazing!
Great new addition. Pretty space. Warm and lively. Everything we ate, except one dish, was delicious.
If you love the dead - you need to stop here. Super cool deli. Amazing food and so many options for salads, subs and paninis. Awesome selections of drinks and chips! Nice people

As of today, I'd only ever heard of this place, but I finally had the time to get in and try it out! I had the Mexicali panini, and it was hands down the best that I've ever had! Oh, and their brownies are to die for! If you ever get a chance, stop in and try them out!

There was a shift change soon after we ordered so they never called our order until we went in 15 minutes later to ask about it. They were super nice about it though and gave us 2 cookies, a brownie, and a s'more. Ridiculously nice people, good food, and one of the most inexpensive eats in Aspen.

Great option for a quick sandwich. Sandwiches are delicious and plenty filling. Aspen in general is an expensive town so finding a quick, inexpensive lunch option was a big win. No indoor seating but they did have a limited number of tables and chairs outside.
Great place for a filling cheap sandwich and a wide variety of options!

Update 12/14/17:  permanently closed. What a loss - Aspen lost a great brunch spot. 

Coffee, juices and breakfast burrito!  This place is the best. Unfortunately, closed on Sunday's.

I've been here a couple of times, and probably will eventually be back. However the coffee is not craft quality, and the pastries I get always taste stale. It promotes a natural and organic atmosphere but it serves all the coffee in disposable cups. The food I see looks good, but this place is basically a Starbucks rip off with a classier facade. It's fine overall, I don't know why I keep waiting my money at this place... Maybe I'm in search of better company.

Locals know best line out door is a true indication of the stellar food and service here.
Not surprising to see movie stars and sports stars stop by for food or coffee.
Wife and I love this place! Ask for Amy she is the best !!

Peach's is my favorite place to get breakfast. Not only is the food fresh and delicious, the staff is wonderful, too. Everyone is friendly and welcoming, especially Chris. Even if he doesn't bring you your food, he'll check on you some time while you're there to make sure everything is good and ask if you need anything else. He even noticed we were repeat customers the second time we came in. The food, the coffee, the people, the atmosphere; everything is just exceptional. I highly recommend you try this place out!

Delicious breakfasts and smoothies. It's a great vegetarian friendly cafe in the area. Prices are above average but not super expensive. 

They also have delicious coffees and lattes.
